results.title: First adaptations
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Coastline Community College and Southern California Consortium
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Time to grow”.
Outlines the degree to which infants are “pre-adapted” to respond to their environment, to allow survival, growth and learning. Brain development is also demonstrated.

Under a general discussion of parents’ expectations of their children, many diverse topics are covered: environment, change in family situation, premature babies and more.

results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Time to grow”.
Discusses the theory of “context” where each child is unique (biological context), but part of the environment (immediate, socio-economic and cultural contexts).

Episode number 1 of Series “Time to grow”.
Introduces the series, defines developmental psychology, provides a brief historical overview, and poses many of the questions discussed in later programs.

results.title: The Boy who drew cats
results.creator_credit: C W Rogers, Ken Hoin and Rabbit Ears Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We all have tales”.
A scary Japanese tale from this multi-award winning series. It tells the story of the smallest child of a peasant family left in the care of the local priest. “Do not forget” his mother said to him, “avoid large places at night; keep to small”. With only these words to guide him, and his only talent of drawing cats, he sets out into the famine-ravaged countryside that is haunted by the spectre of a mysterious demon. Narrated by William Hurt with music by Mark Isham. Drawings and adaptation by David Johnson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: C W Rogers, Ken Hoin and Rabbit Ears Productions

results.title: Jim Gamble puppet classics
results.creator_credit: David Touster, Jonathan Bogner and Bogner Entertainment
results.brief_description: Jim Gamble has been making puppets for many years, including a period making puppets for Disneyland. In this series of delightful puppet plays he brings some of the most well-known children’s stories to life.

group_works.title: The Collector girl = La Collectionneuse

results.title: The Collector girl = La Collectionneuse
results.creator_credit: Eric Rohmer, Barbet Schroeder, Georges de Beauregard, Les Films du Losange and Rome Paris Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Six contes moraux = Six moral tales”.
La Collectionneuse was the first feature Rohmer made in 35mm and colour. Feeling vaguely abandoned as his girlfriend has gone to London, Adrian, a dilettante philosopher, goes to stay at a friend’s villa on the outskirts of St. Tropez. Daniel, an avant-garde artist, and Haydee, a sweetly amoral nymphette who sleeps with a different boy every night, are there also. As the collector of the title, she causes disarray in the two men who decide it is their duty to resist her advances - an intellectual rather than physical moral superiority. It is Adrian, frustrated and chastened, who finally fulfils the moral outline of the series, by hopefully planning a reconciliation with his girlfriend.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eric Rohmer, Barbet Schroeder, Georges de Beauregard, Les Films du Losange and Rome Paris Films
